node.title: Banking sector bounces back as Covid-19 impact falls short of predictions
node.description: The country's banking sector has roared back from the pandemic with record profits fuelled by a red hot housing market and provisions made for possible losses caused by Covid-19.

node.title: Loss of identity, whānau,  whakapapa worst effects of state care - Māori survivor
node.description: Māori children who were put through state care as children have spoken of the indignity of being stripped of their identity.

node.title: Fast-track visa applicants offered money for fake marriages
node.description: Migrants who will soon become residents under a government fast-tracked visa process are being offered more than $30,000 to enter bogus marriages, according to an immigration adviser.

node.title: Corrections managing hundreds of Covid-19 cases among inmates
node.description: There are now hundreds of prisoners infected with Covid-19 in the country's Corrections facilities.

node.title: Crowd boost for Cricket World Cup
node.description: Increased crowd numbers can now attend Cricket World Cup matches in New Zealand.

node.title: Homeland Security identified threats prior to January 6 but did not share intelligence, watchdog says
node.description: Trump administration analysts failed to "produce any actionable information" or issue intelligence bulletins to their network of law enforcement partners until two days after the Capitol insurrection, the report said.

node.title: Bill banning gender-affirming care for children passes Idaho House
node.description: The bill now moves to the state Senate.

node.title: 'A perfect storm': Wellington GPs working overtime as Covid-19 cases surge
node.description: Wellington's frontline care workers are operating around the clock to help people with Covid-19 who are isolating at home.

node.title: Neighbours divided over Russian oligarch's lodge in Northland
node.description: Northlanders living near a luxury lodge owned by a Russian oligarch are putting up Ukrainian flags on their properties.

node.title: Tourism recovery fund only a stopgap fix, operators say
node.description: Tourism businesses in the five hardest-hit regions say targeted government funding has been a boon but not a silver bullet.

node.title: Ukraine war: US announces ban on Russian oil
node.description: The United States has announced a complete US ban on Russian oil, gas and coal imports, while the EU and Britain announced bans and curbs.

node.title: Warriors name Kodi Nikorima to partner Shaun Johnson in NRL opener
node.description: Shaun Johnson's comeback game for the Warriors will be alongside Kodi Nikorima in the team's opening fixture of the 2022 NRL season.

node.title: Apple's new budget iPhone is 5G  — and pricier
node.description: Third-generation iPhone SE marks the first upgrade to the bare-bones version of Apple's most popular product.

node.title: Scans reveal how Covid-19 may change the brain
node.description: Even after a mild infection, the overall size of the brain had shrunk, researchers found.

node.title: U.S. intelligence shows Iran threats on U.S. soil
node.description: There are "serious and credible" threats to current and former U.S. officials, including against former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo.

node.title: 5 ways to save on gas as prices soar to a record high
node.description: With a gallon of regular around the U.S. now averaging $4.17, here's how drivers can save money at the pump.

node.title: Coke and Pepsi suspend business in Russia, cite "events in Ukraine"
node.description: World's largest beverage companies join McDonald's in stopping short of direct condemnation of Moscow for invasion.

node.title: Three waters reforms: working group urges govt financial backing
node.description: Councils should have shares in three waters entities - with the government on the hook financially, a working group of mayors and Māori representatives says. Audio

node.title: Omicron brings Auckland tunnelling machine to a halt
node.description: The hold-up at Watercare's new Interceptor tunnel is just one casualty from the virus rampaging through the construction sector.

node.title: Barr: Trump got "madder and madder" when rebuffed on election fraud claims
node.description: When former President Trump summoned then U.S. Attorney General William Barr in early December, he knew it wasn't going to be a pleasant meeting.

node.title: Coworker accused of stabbing mom, her 2 sons in daylight Philadelphia attack
node.description: Hengian Ni faces multiple charges, including attempt to commit rape and three counts of attempt to commit murder.

node.title: Auckland mayor Phil Goff announces he has Covid-19
node.description: Auckland mayor Phil Goff says he has tested positive for Covid-19.

node.title: DNA from bite wound helps solve 1994 murder of California mom
node.description: Cheri Huss was found stabbed to death and bitten by her killer inside her Desert Hot Springs apartment 28 years ago.

node.title: Tepid response from Ukrainians in NZ on govt's Russia sanctions
node.description: Ukrainians in New Zealand says the government's sanctions plan is long overdue, but may have come too late.

node.title: Russia warns of oil import ban as little progress made at Ukraine talks
node.description: There are growing fears of an energy war after the US pushed its allies to ban Russian oil imports due to its invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Petrol companies report increase in thefts as prices surge
node.description: As petrol costs rise, Z Energy and Caltex have reported an increase in petrol thefts. Meanwhile, the appetite for electric vehicles appears to be gradually growing. Audio

node.title: Evacuation orders issued for several suburbs in south-western Sydney, flood threat increases
node.description: Tens of thousands of residents across a swathe of south-western Sydney suburbs have been told to evacuate immediately due to flooding concerns.

node.title: 'We've met the nicest people': Dog owners barking mad over beach ban
node.description: A new dog control bylaw in New Plymouth has got canine lovers in a spin. Audio

node.title: 'Only individuals can judge how unwell they are', nurses union says
node.description: Unions representing healthcare workers have hit back at the Ministry of Health's announcement that critical healthcare workers can return to work six days earlier if they have two negative rapid…

node.title: Putin "undeterred" by economic sanctions and military setbacks in Ukraine, U.S. intel leaders say
node.description: An "aggrieved" Putin likely "perceives this as a war he cannot afford to lose," said director of national intelligence Avril Haines.
